reviewText: Grab a box of tissues, and settle in to cry.  Fried Green Tomatoes ain't got nothing on these four movies.  Nicholas Sparks writes so believable.  James Garner and Gena Rowlands are so sweet together, Richard Gere and Diane Lane make sparks together.  And oh my, Kevin Costner makes you wish you were in his arms instead of Robin Wright Penn.  These are the kind of movies you think about and remember for days after watching them. Buy them, you won't regret it.

Would buy again from this seller.  Item arrived quickly, and in condition described.

The recent discovery of the little brain in the hearta collection of sensory neurons that think, remember and learn independently from the neurons in our brainnow gives new meaning to the role that heart-intelligence can play in our lives. The state of harmony that we create for ourselves in heart-brain coherence accesses whats true for us in the moment in any situation. Rather than thinking through a list of pros and cons or weighing out the probability that an experience of the past will repeat itself in the present, our heart-intelligence knows instantly whats true and meaningful for us.

WoW.

All 4 Movie are very good, but my favorite one was Nights in Rodanthe. Filmed on location in The Out Banks of North Carolina. The house is a rental house that you can rent by the week. Looks pretty much the same as in the movie, other than it was moved about 15 mile down the beach to save it. Once you see the movie you will understand why they had to move it. Some friends of mine have stayed there, and loved the house. So Over all It's a Romantic movie and a good one at that. So have some tissue near by...

Even though I am not much of a romance reader I really love Nicholas Sparks' work.  "The Notebook" is by far my most favorite from him.  I even loved the movie that was made in 2004 of the novel.  And I also loved other adaptions like "A Walk To Remember" and "Message in a Bottle".  However, I never really did see "Nights in Rodanthe".  But the other three films were just amazingly created.

I never felt so emotional about romance novels or movies before.  I was always the action-adventure type of guy.  But then I saw the movie "The Notebook" and that was when I was introduced to Nicholas Sparks.  I watched the other adaptions and I just really like them for some reason.  I later figured out that the reason I love them is because I find myself rooting for the couples in the movies and novels.  I just care about these characters and I really want them to be together, like as if it is the end of the world if they don't get together in the end.

What else can say?  These movies are full of romance that they will leave you with goose-bumps and your heart pounding for more.  I say buy it.  That includes you husbands and boyfriends out there!  Get your true love something like this and I promise you that there will be plenty of kisses to go around.  ;)

This is worth buying and I'll leave it at that!

As I said I love reading Nicholas Sparks books and watching them now In movie form is awesome. These movies come so close to reading the books themselves and the actors picked play their parts flawlessly. I have only one problem with this purchase. Instead of just throwing all the discs into one container on top of each other, Couldn't you find a way to package it so the discs don't become scratched and are placed in this case separately? My father has received a number of old westerns and they are always placed so each disc has it's own place. That is my only concern about this order. Otherwise it's fantastic.

I am sure there are those who would disagree with me, but the story's all seem to have the same general plot. I recommend if you get this to not pull a Nicholas sparks movie marathon with these or they are less interesting. Otherwise if viewed over a period of time, they aren't bad.

The Notebook and A Walk to Remember are both great movies.  The Notebook particularly killed me because my mother currently has Alzheimers and lives with us.  Some very powerful and touching scenes in both movies.  I'd give them both 5 stars.  Nights in Rondanthe was good toward the end, but I just didn't buy most of it.  My wife and I both felt that the romance was forced and contrived.  They had conversations that were just completely unlikely at such an early stage of knowing one another.  It was awkward to watch at times.  Still, 2 out of 3 of the movies are 5 stars.  And Nights in Rodanthe was still enjoyable on the whole.  I definitely would not have spent $11 to watch in a movie theatre though!  Still waiting to see Message in a Bottle.
These are some of my favorite movies -- and Nicholas Sparks is a favorite too.  Love his books and his movies NEVER disappoint me.  Have loaned this video out to others.

I was interested in two of the four before I found this set, but was happy to have come across it because it was such a great price to include four great movies. One thing worth mentioning (the reason for 4 stars instead of 5) is that all four discs come stacked together in one case: they don't each have their own 'page' whether hard plastic snap-in or cloth-type insert which would, of course, better protect each disc, so it might not be a good idea for those who are rough on their things or have kids who aren't careful. But this does save space from having four separate DVDs on my shelf and is such a bargain that it hardly matters!

It's not easy to add four great movies to your DVD collection for this price. I had only seen two of the movies before buying (The Notebook and A Walk to Remember) and knew that those two movies alone were worth the $10 spent on the four-pack. If you're a movie watcher and love at least one of these movies already, invest in this four-pack!

I've got a very eclectic taste, and buy quite a few multi-packs.

It's rare for a multipack to have four very good films, maybe not blockbuster status, but good. That's a fair description here.

If you like romance or romantic comedy there's not one of these that will dissappoint.

Without giving too much away I'd place them as follows:

Message in a bottle was the best of the bunch, a personal opinion only, as it involved both detective work and sailing, it rated as close to 5 stars as can be given. Costner's performance was the only bit that left just a fraction to be desired. It has a somewhat surreal subplot/message that nothing we ever do is gone for good, that life finds it's way to completing the circle.

Night's in Rodanthe and a Walk to Remember are both great for a rainy afternoon or stormy evening. Sofa, ice-cream, brownies and turn off the phone. 4 stars and 3 stars respectively, but only just 4 and should perhaps be more than 3.

The Notebook is possibly the least desired of the bunch personally, I'm not one who's so big on movies containing lots of flashbacks or based around them, but the acting, especially Garner's and storyline are still easily good enough to make it worth watching more than once. This was a case of where Costner lowered the overall quality of "Message" slightly, this one just wouldn't have worked without the ageing Garner.

It's a good set, in a nice box, delivered quickly and absolutely enjoyed. There were no issues with quality or getting them to play in either of our players.

More details would spoil the movies so if you like this genere, invest and watch.
You'll possibly enjoy the investment as much as I did.
